name: North Moat Mountain

trails_config.name: Moat Mountain Trail (Red Ridge Loop)
trails_config.description: A challenging but spectacular loop from Diana’s Baths: ascend via Moat Mountain Trail to the expansive Red Ridge, which provides long stretches of open rock and great views of Mount Washington and the Saco River valley. Join the Moat Mountain Trail on the ridge to tag North Moat’s summit, then descend steeply past forested ledges and small cascades to return. This loop covers a variety of terrain, from waterfalls at the start to alpine-like ridge walking, making it one of the most rewarding non-4K hikes in the Whites.
trails_config.parking_info: Diana's Baths Trailhead, West Side Rd (North Conway)

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, North Moat Mountain rises to 3202 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3202 feet, North Moat Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Moat Mountain Trail (Red Ridge Loop)**, a **10.2 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Resolution**, which is just 6.2 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
